notes: GVM: p.142 "When used in primary derivation, the final often indicates action that is not volitional on the part of the subject but rather tends to express action that could be considered 'relational' between the subject and object. Used secondarily, it also tends to be used for relational action but can be used for volitional action-- although in this case, the action prototypically does not directly change or affect the object."
